00038 CMD_Init(const CommandList commandList, uint16_t length) {

00051 void
00052 CMD_RunCommand(char *line) {
00053   char *cmd;
00054   char *args;
00055 
00056   cmd  = line;
00057   args = line;
00058 
00059   // Find the space delimiter between command and arguments
00060   while(*args != ' ' && *args)
00061     args++;
00062   
00063   // If there are argument, args will be on the space delimiter
00064   if(*args != '\0') {
00065     *args = '\0';
00066     args++;
00067   }
00068 
00069   /* Right now both cmd and args should
00070     be pointing to null terminated strings */
00071 
00072   // Empty command? Ignore
00073   if(*cmd == '\0') {
00074     return;
00075   }
00076 
00077   // Else, try to run the command
00078   CMD_FindAndRun(cmd, args);
00079 }
00080 
00081 
00091 void
00092 CMD_FindAndRun(char *cmd, char *args) {
00093   unsigned int i=0;
00094   uint8_t found = 0;
00095 
00096   // Linear search, but it's not that important... right?
00097   for(i=0; i<cmdLength; i++) {
00098     if(strcmp(cmdList[i].commandName, cmd) == 0) {
00099       cmdList[i].callback(args);
00100       found = 1;
00101       break;
00102     }
00103   }
00104   
00105   if(!found) {
00106     printf("Unk cmd\n");
00107   }
00108 }
